intro: Lycianthes talamancensis, commonly known as the Talamancan eggplant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into egg-shaped, green fruits. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough texture and dark green color. Lycianthes talamancensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
